Description: Job SummaryResident is responsible for providing the care of his/her patients maintaining a high-level ofprofessional performance in accordance with: Evidence based medicine. Professional medical ethics and JCIA/CBAHI standards. Hospital medical by-laws. Laws of Ministry of Health in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and any other applicableregulations according to the departmental quality plan.Major Duties and Responsibilities Ensures through his actions, either directly or indirectly, that a superior quality of medical treatment, compassion and understanding is given to every patient served at the NMC Hospitals and Clinics. Provides patient care within the parameters of their professional competence as reflected in the scope of their clinical privileges. Performs history taking, physical examinations, interpretation of common diagnostic tests and formulation of a plan management; on admission. Conducts daily wards rounds, on all inpatients in the section. Liaises with the concerned consultant with regards to care of his inpatients. Assumes an active part in the On-Call Rotations in the Department and participates actively in the morning report together with this Consultant on-call and the moderator. Admits patients from the hospital referral facilities (e.g. ER and OPD) upon appropriate discussion with the Consultant under whose name the admission is done. Evaluates all new admissions and coordinates with the Consultant and Senior Registrar a plan of investigation to establish a diagnosis and a management course. Executes the plan, approved by the Consultant/Senior Registrar. Seeks the advice and guidance of his seniors whenever the condition of a patient merits further expertise. Documents all plans in the patient's charts and keeps an updated follow-up in the progress notes. Presents the previous day's admissions in the morning report when resident on duty. Participates in the On-Call Rota of the Department for patient care and admissions.Skills
Skills:  University Medical Degree i.e. M.B., B.S. (graduate in medicine) or a recognized
 Recognized as a Resident by the Saudi Council for Health Specialties.
 Additional qualifications in his specialty, if any.
 Minimum of two (2) years after obtaining his/her degree.
 Current valid license to practice medicine in the area of his specialty.
 Fluent in spoken and written English.
 Communication in spoken Arabic is desirable.
 Exhibits professionalism and excellent interpersonal communication skills.
 Is knowledgeable of the Medical by-laws.
